''[[Comedy Nights with Kapil]]''
| ethnicity = }} '''Kapil Sharma''' (born 2 April 1981){{Cite news|url=https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/television/happy-birthday-kapil-sharma-5-things-you-didnt-know-about-comedy-king-4596027/|title=Kapil Sharma Birthday|last=|first=|date=2 Apr 2017|work=Indian Express|access-date=4 May 2017}} is an Indian [[Stand-up comedy|stand-up comedian]], television presenter, actor and producer. He also hosted television comedy shows like ''[[Comedy Nights with Kapil]]'', ''[[The Kapil Sharma Show]].'' Ormax Media rated Sharma the most popular Indian television personality in April 2016.{{cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tv/news/hindi/Kapil-Sharma-beats-Salman-Khan-to-become-the-most-popular-TV-personality/articleshow/52341114.cms|title=Kapil Sharma beats Salman Khan to become the most popular TV personality|date=3 September 2016|work=The Times of India}} [[Forbes]] India ranked him at 11th position in their Celebrity 100 list in the year 2016.{{cite web|url=https://www.forbesindia.com/lists/2016-celebrity-100/1587/1 |title=Forbes India Celebrity 100 |work=[[Forbes India]]}} Forbes India ranked him at 18th position in their Celebrity 100 list in the year 2017 with an income of Rs. 48 crore.{{Cite web|url=https://www.forbesindia.com/lists/2017-celebrity-100/1665/all|title=2017 Celebrity 100 - Forbes India Magazine|website=Forbes India|language=en-US|access-date=December 22, 2017}} He was awarded the [[CNN-IBN]] Indian of the Year 2013, in the Entertainment category and was ranked third in the Most Admired Indian Personality List by ''[[The Economic Times]]'' in 2015.[https://m.economictimes.com/slideshows/people/20-most-admired-people-in-india/kapil-sharma/slideshow/47260028.cms Kapil Sharma – 20 most admired people in India | ''The Economic Times''] (13 May 2015). Retrieved on 16 September 2015. Sharma was nominated for the ''[[Swachh Bharat Abhiyan]]'' by the Indian Prime Minister [[Narendra Modi]][https://m.timesofindia.com/tv/news/hindi/Kapil-Sharma-Will-do-my-best-for-Swachh-Bharat-Abhiyaan/articleshow/45640400.cms Kapil Sharma: Will do my best for Swachh Bharat Abhiyaan – ''The Times of India''] (25 December 2014). Retrieved on 16 September 2015. and was invited to the [[Rashtrapati Bhavan]] by President [[Pranab Mukherjee]] in September 2015 to acknowledge his contribution for the same.[https://m.koimoi.com/bollywood-news/kapil-sharma-to-meet-president-pranab-mukherjee KoiMoi – Kapil Sharma To Meet President Pranab Mukherjee]. M.koimoi.com (11 September 2015). Retrieved on 16 September 2015. ==Early and personal life== Kapil was born in [[Amritsar]], [[Punjab, India|Punjab]].{{cite web|url=https://indianexpress.com/article/lifestyle/food-wine/kapil-sharma-on-amritsars-matthi-chhole-scotch-whisky-and-punjabis-and-dieting-the-foodie-interview-2820038/ |title=Comedian Kapil Sharma on Amritsar’s matthi chhole, Scotch whisky, and Punjabis and dieting |publisher=[[The Indian Express]]}} His father Jeetendra Kumar Punj was a head constable in the [[Punjab Police (India)|Punjab Police]] while his mother Janak Rani is a housewife.{{cite news|title=Life has changed ever since, says comedian Kapil's family|url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/punjab/amritsar/life-has-changed-ever-since-says-comedian-kapil-s-family/article1-1173318.aspx|accessdate=18 December 2014|work=Hindustan Times}} His father was diagnosed with cancer in 1997 and died in 2004 at [[AIIMS]] in [[Delhi]].{{cite web|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tv/news/hindi/Kapil-Sharma-Seeing-my-daddy-suffer-in-his-last-days-I-prayed-to-God-to-take-him/articleshow/39944224.cms |title=Mr. Sharma: Seeing my daddy suffer in his last days, I prayed to God to take him |publisher=[[The Times of India]]}} He studied at the Khalsa college in [[Amritsar]], [[Punjab, India|Punjab]]. Kapil Sharma has a brother named Ashok Kumar Sharma, who is a Police constable and a sister named Pooja Pawan Devgan.{{cite web|url=https://www.bollywoodlife.com/news-gossip/kapil-sharmas-personal-life-in-pictures/ |title=Kapil Sharma's personal life in pictures |publisher=Bollywood Life}} He studied in Dav Public School, Lawerence road, Amritsar. Kapil Sharma who has always been tight-lipped about his relationship, surprised everyone by introducing girlfriend Ginni Chatrath to the world on 18 March 2017.{{cite web|url=http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/television/kapil-sharma-engaged-to-marry-fiance-ginni-chatrath-who-is-ginni-here-everything-to-know-see-pics-4574554/|title=Kapil Sharma to marry Ginni Chatrath. Who is Ginni? See pics|date=18 March 2017|publisher=}} ==Career== Kapil rose to fame after winning the comedy reality television show ''[[The Great Indian Laughter Challenge]]'' in 2007, for which he won a cash prize of [[Indian rupee|INR]] ₹10 lakh.{{cite news |title= Kapil Sharma plays the 'Traffic monitor' at India Gate |url= https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/tv/news-and-gossip/Kapil-Sharma-plays-the-Traffic-monitor-at-India-Gate/articleshow/22334306.cms |work=The Times of India |date= 26 September 2013}} He had previously worked in the Punjabi show ''Hasde Hasande Ravo'' on MH One channel.{{cite web|url=https://www.thequint.com/entertainment/2016/04/02/funny-punjabi-punjab-amritsar-comedian-television-odd-jobs |title=5 Things You Didn’t Know About Birthday Boy Kapil Sharma |publisher=Quint}} [[File:Prabhudeva, Sonu Sood, Shahid Kapoor, Sonakshi Sinha and Kapil Sharma on the sets of Comedy Nights with Kapil.jpg|Sharma (second from left) on the sets of ''Comedy Nights with Kapil'' in 2013|right|thumb]] He participated in [[Sony Entertainment Television (India)|Sony]]'s ''[[Comedy Circus]]''{{cite web|url=https://www.siasat.com/english/news/parvati-singhal-kapil-crown-comedy-king |title=Parvati Singhal, Kapil crown Comedy King |publisher=Siasat |date=29 August 2010 |accessdate=3 March 2014}} and went on to win six seasons of the show.[https://m.timesofindia.com/tv/news/hindi/Kapil-wins-yet-another-season-of-Comedy-Circus/articleshow/11131528.cms Kapil wins yet another season of Comedy Circus – The Times of India]. M.timesofindia.com (16 December 2011). Retrieved on 16 September 2015. He also hosted the dance reality show ''[[Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa (season 6)|Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa Season 6]]''[https://forbesindia.com/celebprofile/kapil-sharma/186 Kapil Sharma] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141225093429/https://forbesindia.com/celebprofile/kapil-sharma/186 |date=25 December 2014 }}. Forbesindia.com. Retrieved on 16 September 2015. and another comedy show ''[[Chhote Miyan]]''.{{cite news|author=Aparna Banerji |url=https://www.tribuneindia.com/2009/20090724/jplus.htm#3 |title=Lady laughter sends T-town rolling |work=Tribune India |date=24 July 2009 |accessdate=21 July 2014}}{{cite news| title = Daily soaps weren't creatively satisfying: Manish Paul | url = https://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2013-08-11/tv/41293838_1_kapil-sharma-manish-paul-humour|date=11 August 2013 | accessdate = 16 August 2013 | work = [[The Times of India]] }} Kapil was seen as a contestant in the show ''[[Ustaadon Ka Ustaad]]'' in 2008. In 2013, Kapil launched his own show, ''[[Comedy Nights with Kapil]]'', under his banner K9 Productions on [[Colors (TV channel)|Colors]]. At the CNN-IBN Indian of the Year awards 2013, Kapil was felicitated with the Indian of the Year award in the entertainment category by veteran actor [[Amol Palekar]].{{cite news|author=Wadehra, Randeep |url=https://www.tribuneindia.com/2007/20070916/spectrum/main3.htm|title=The Great Punjabi Challenge|date=16 September 2007|work=[[The Tribune (Chandigarh)|The Tribune]]}} During the [[Indian general election, 2014|2014 Lok Sabha Elections]], he was appointed the Brand Ambassador by the Delhi Election Commission.[https://news.biharprabha.com/2014/04/comedian-kapil-sharma-to-be-brand-ambassador-for-delhi-poll/ Comedian Kapil Sharma to be brand ambassador for Delhi poll]. News.biharprabha.com (5 April 2014). Retrieved on 16 September 2015. Kapil was the co-host of the [[60th Filmfare Awards|60th]] [[Filmfare Awards]] in 2015 along with [[Karan Johar]].Narayan, Girija. (5 February 2015) [https://www.filmibeat.com/television/news/2015/when-kapil-sharma-stole-karan-johars-thunder-at-filmfare-awards-2015-172887.html When Kapil Sharma Stole Karan Johar's Thunder At Filmfare Awards 2015!]. Filmibeat. Retrieved on 16 September 2015. He was the presenter for the fourth season of [[Celebrity Cricket League]], 2014.Narayan, Girija. (20 January 2014) [https://www.filmibeat.com/television/news/2014/kapil-sharma-host-ccl-2014-launch-event-had-sachin-dhanush-venkatesh-130122.html Kapil Sharma To Host CCL 2014; Launch Event With Sachin, Dhanush, Venkatesh...]. Filmibeat. Retrieved on 16 September 2015. He appeared as a guest on the opening episode of the eighth season of the Indian television game show ''[[Kaun Banega Crorepati]]''{{cite news|url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/kapil-sharma-amitabh-bachchan-first-guest-kbc-8/1/374806.html |title=Kapil Sharma is Amitabh Bachchan's first guest on KBC 8 |publisher=India Today |date=30 July 2014 |accessdate=30 July 2014}} and also as a celebrity guest on ''[[The Anupam Kher Show]]''.Narayan, Girija. (19 August 2014) [https://www.filmibeat.com/television/news/2014/read-emotional-revelations-kapil-sharma-made-the-anupam-kher-show-157089.html#slide63377 Emotional Revelations Kapil Sharma Made On The Anupam Kher Show!]. Filmibeat. Retrieved on 16 September 2015. He also appeared as a guest in [[Koffee with Karan|Koffee With Karan]] in 2017. Kapil made his [[Bollywood]] debut as the male lead in the movie ''[[Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon]]'', a romantic-comedy directed by [[Abbas Mustan]] opposite four actresses, [[Elli Avram]], [[Manjari Phadnis]], [[Simran Kaur Mundi]] and [[Sai Lokur]].{{cite news|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/entertainment/hindi/bollywood/news/Kapil-Sharmas-film-goes-on-floor/articleshow/45078735.cms|title=Kapil Sharma's film goes on floor|date=8 November 2014|work=The Times of India}} The film was released on 25 September 2015 to mixed reviews from critics and did record breaking opening day business for a debutant.{{cite news | title = Kapil Sharma's film sets box office on fire | url = https://m.indiatoday.in/story/kis-kisko-pyaar-karoon-collection-kapil-sharmas-debut-film-sets-box-office-on-fire-in-its-opening-weekend/1/484955.html}}[https://m.ibtimes.co.in/kis-kisko-pyaar-karoon-opening-day-box-office-collection-kapil-sharmas-movie-smashes-records-648159 'Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon' opening day box office collection: Kapil Sharma's movie smashes records; Beats 'Baby' 1st day business] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150927142004/https://m.ibtimes.co.in/kis-kisko-pyaar-karoon-opening-day-box-office-collection-kapil-sharmas-movie-smashes-records-648159 |date=27 September 2015 }}. M.ibtimes.co.in. Retrieved on 27 September 2015. After the end of ''[[Comedy Nights with Kapil]]'', Kapil signed a contract with Sony TV for a new show called ''[[The Kapil Sharma Show]]''. Its last episode was aired on 24 January 2016. After that he started working on [[Sony Entertainment Television (India)|Sony Entertainment Television]] for ''[[The Kapil Sharma Show]]'' under his [[imdbcompany:0459852|K9 Productions]]. ''The Kapil Sharma Show'' started airing on 23 April 2016 and received a positive response from the viewers.{{cite web|url=https://m.timesofindia.com/tv/news/hindi/The-Kapil-Sharma-Show-tops-the-non-fiction-category/articleshow/52906878.cms|title=The Kapil Sharma Show tops the non-fiction category – TOI Mobile – The Times of India Mobile Site|work=timesofindia.com|accessdate=6 September 2016}}{{Cite web|url=https://thekapilsharmashowtv.com|title=The Kapil Sharma Show Watch Full Episodes Online Sony TV Know About |website=The Kapil Sharma Show TV|language=en-US|access-date=8 April 2016}} As of December 2016, he has signed two movies and is currently working on them.{{cite web|url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tv/news/hindi/Kiku-Sunil-Grover-wish-Kapil-Sharma-luck-for-his-new-journey-in-Punjab/articleshow/55666069.cms|title=Kiku, Sunil Grover wish Kapil Sharma luck for his new journey in Punjab|work=India Tv}}{{cite web|url=https://www.indiatvnews.com/entertainment/bollywood-kapil-sharma-second-movie-details-356670|title=Apparently, Kapil Sharma can’t wait for second movie to start; details here|work=India Tv}} Also he has renewed his contract with [[Sony Entertainment Television (India)|Sony Entertainment Television]] for ''[[The Kapil Sharma Show]]''.{{Cite news|url=https://news.liveurlifehere.com/in/know-much-kapil-sharma-charge-contract-renewal-sony-tv.html|title=Do you know how much Kapil Sharma charge for contract renewal with Sony TV|date=5 December 2016|newspaper=Liveurlifehere News|access-date=22 December 2016}} His second movie ''[[Firangi]]'' was released on 1 December 2017. Directed by Rajiev Dhingra, ''Firangi'' is a historical period drama film set in the year 1920. His latest show had launched on 25 March 2018 stating as ''[[Family Time With Kapil Sharma]]''. ==Activism== Kapil has been known for his efforts in promoting animal rights. He and the cast of ''[[Comedy Nights with Kapil]]'' appeared in a [[PETA]] campaign to promote adoption of homeless cats and dogs.[https://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/television/comedy-nights-with-kapil-cast-in-new-peta-campaign/ ‘Comedy Nights With Kapil’ cast in new PETA campaign]. ''The Indian Express'' (8 July 2015). Retrieved on 16 September 2015. In July 2014, he adopted a homeless dog sxheuc, a retired police dog from [[Mumbai]]. He has also campaigned to save tortured elephants across the country.[https://m.timesofindia.com/tv/news/hindi/10-reasons-why-we-love-Kapil-Sharma/articleshow/47816657.cms 10 reasons why we love Kapil Sharma – ''The Times of India''] (26 June 2015). Retrieved on 16 September 2015. Sharma was nominated for the ''[[Swachh Bharat Abhiyan]]'' by the Indian Prime Minister [[Narendra Modi]] for which he campaigned and regularly promotes on his show. ===Twitter controversy=== On 9 September 2016, Sharma tweeted and tagged the Prime Minister [[Narendra Modi]], that he was asked to pay to someone at the [[Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation]] (BMC) for making his office even though he was paying large amount in taxes. Sharma did not name anybody in this case, nor did he lodge a complaint with BMC. Responding to his tweet the Chief Minister [[Devendra Fadnavis]], asked him to furnish all information to enable them to take strict action. Thereafter, the BMC started gathering evidence against him related to illegal activities in his Oshiwara office and Goregaon apartment. The Oshiwara police also registered a case against Sharma and builder Dev Land and Housing Private Ltd (DLH). The FIR was registered by BMC’s P South Ward sub-engineer Abhay Jagtap. However, Sharma had claimed in the HC that the building was constructed as per the sanctioned plan.{{citeweb|url=https://m.mid-day.com/amp/articles/kapil-sharma-to-get-personal-hearing-from-bmc-mumbai-news-illegal-construction/18103174|title=Illegal constructions: Kapil Sharma to get personal hearing from BMC|accessdate=26 March 2017}} Yet again in 2018 Kapil Sharma has been on an abusive Twitter rant since April 6, Friday. A few of the tweets had abusive language in Hindi. Some were also targeted at a journalist "who only spread(s) negativity about me for very little money", later he claimed that his twitter account was hacked.{{Cite web|url=https://m.mid-day.com/amp/articles/kapil-sharma-on-offensive-tweets-my-account-was-hacked/19291196|title=Kapil Sharma On Offensive Tweets: My Account Was Hacked|last=|first=|date=|website=Mid-day|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}} He also abused a senior journalist over the phone, following which, the journalist shared that call recording on social media. This got Kapil fuming with anger and he lodged a complaint against the journalist and his previous show, The Kapil Sharma Show's producers, Preeti and Neeti Simoes. He has accused them of extorting Rs 25 lacs from him and in a bid of failing to fulfill the requirement; he has allegedly accused them of tarnishing their image on digital media.{{Cite web|url=https://m.mid-day.com/amp/articles/preeti-simoes-on-kapil-sharmas-complaint-i-think-he-is-suicidal-and-i-am-scared-for-him/19294171|title=Preeti Simoes On Kapil Sharma's Complaint: I Think He Is Suicidal And I Am Scared For Him|last=|first=|date=|website=Mid-day|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}} ===Brawl with Sunil Grover=== In March 2017, during their return flight from [[Melbourne]], when [[Sunil Grover]], his co-actor, tried to intervene, Sharma had reportedly used some offensive words. When the controversy gathered media attention, he posted on his Facebook page to explain the events also apologizing to Grover for his actions on his Twitter handle. Grover, however, took offense and posted a message advising Sharma to handle his fame better and respect his co-actors.{{Cite news|url=https://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/kapil-sharmas-fight-with-sunil-grover- March 2017|title=Kapil Sharma apologises to Sunil Grover on Twitter|last=|first=|date=21 March 2017|access-date=|work=Times of India}}{{cite web|last1=Mathew|first1=Suresh|title=Now Kapil Sharma Responds to Sunil Grover’s Angry Tweet|url=https://www.thequint.com/bollywood/2017/03/21/sunil-grover-tweets-against-kapil-sharma-asks-him-to-stop-acting-like-he-is-god|website=The Quint|accessdate=22 March 2017}} Nobody explained what really happened during the flight with overly exaggerated media reports doing rounds. Subsequently, Grover, along with [[Ali Asgar (actor)|Ali Asgar]], [[Chandan Prabhakar]], [[Sugandha Mishra]] quit ''The Kapil Sharma Show''. However, [[Chandan Prabhakar]] returned after few weeks. Later on during the trailer launch of his movie, Sharma opened up about the event and told what really happened brushing away the exaggerated media reports and speculations.{{Cite news|url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/tv/kapil-sharma-says-he-never-fought-with-sunil-grover-my-fight-was-with-chandan-prabhakar/story-ovfT086NgkG5wjS13lrdqJ.html|title=Kapil Sharma says he never
